message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CR 

This paper is about inverse reinforcement learning (IRL), which is a subfield of artificial intelligence (AI) that deals with learning reward functions from demonstrations. Therefore, cs.AI is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses algorithmic teaching, which is a subfield of machine learning (ML) that deals with designing optimal training sets for learners. This makes cs.LG a likely sub-category as well. The paper also applies the proposed machine teaching algorithm to two novel applications: benchmarking active learning IRL algorithms and developing an IRL algorithm that uses counterfactual reasoning over informative demonstrations to learn more efficiently. These applications involve robotics (cs.RO), control systems (cs.SY), and cryptography (cs.CR), respectively, making them less likely but still plausible sub-categories.
